meanings.definition: To treat or combine with methyl alcohol.
meanings.sent1: I will methylate the solution with methyl alcohol.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often methylate compounds to study their properties.
meanings.sent3: The potion was so powerful that even a drop of methylated it instantly!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to methylate the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight appeared to methylate the colors of the flowers, making them glow.

meanings.definition: To introduce a methyl group into a compound.
meanings.sent1: The chemist will methylate the compound for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to methylate organic compounds in research.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally methylated the recipe, creating a new dish!
meanings.sent4: His ideas seemed to methylate the team, sparking creativity.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to methylate the canvas, adding depth to the painting.
